fields.Title of Presentation: Learning, Moods and Atmospheres: A Phenomenological Video Analysis
fields.Sponsoring Organization: Institution for Educational Studies, U. of Goettingen
fields.Description/Abstract: It is a shared mood or atmosphere that determines the way that the world is disclosed to us. If every atmosphere brings with it a shared interpretation of the world, then one needs to share or participate in this atmosphere in order to share knowledge or learning. Only when a Stimmung suitable to such disclosure has been cultivated or encountered will the sought‐after knowledge “dawn” on one. I begin by discussing the elusive epistemology of the atmospheric—what we are able to know about how we know, what access we have to the atmospheric, to the mode of our being and knowing. Then, through a brief video example, I go on to discuss what can be seen to make an atmosphere, a shared way of knowing, specifically pedagogical.
